title: Leading Cybersecurity Curriculum Reform at Al Ain University
description:
Advocated for a shift from theoretical teaching to practical, hands-on learning using platforms like TryHackMe and Hack The Box.
Proposed integrating real-world labs and gamified challenges into coursework.
Collaborating with the head of cybersecurity and senior cybersecurity professors to implement reforms.

title: Ultimate Cybersecurity Path
description:
Created a clear and structured cybersecurity learning path that takes learners from beginner to professional.
Designed its curriculum to cover Presecurity, Cybersecurity Fundamentals, Essential Programming, Primary Cybersecurity Fields, Professional & Advanced Certifications, Specialization, and Soft Skills.
I've built it on reputable platforms like TryHackMe, Hack The Box, and TCM Security with focus on affordability and real-world applications.

title: Active Directory (AD) Home Labs
description:
Built and configured 3 Active Directory home labs with Domain Controllers and connected VMs to simulate enterprise environments.
Focused on AD security and exploitation.

title: 25+ Virtual Machine Lab Environments
description:
Built and configured over 25 virtual machines (Linux & Windows) using VirtualBox.
Configured NAT networks to simulate internal infrastructure for testing and analysis.

title: 130+ Practical Security Challenges Completed (Red & Blue Teaming)
description:
Completed over 130 hands-on security challenges covering both red teaming (offensive) and blue teaming (defensive) concepts.
Solved security challenges in Splunk BOTS (Boss of the SOC) and other platforms including TryHackMe and Hack The Box.

title: Cybersecurity CTF Writeups Repository
description:
Created an organized collection of my Capture The Flag (CTF) writeups, documenting my journey in cybersecurity learning and hands-on practice.
Detailed the challenges faced, methodologies used, and lessons learned across various CTF challenges.

title: CTF Competitions Participation
description:
Participated in 42CTF (by RedTeam Hacker Academy & 42 Abu Dhabi) and Cybersecurity Awareness Day 4.0 CTF (by Abu Dhabi University).
Focused on exploitation, threat analysis, and security operations in timed, high-pressure settings.
